active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the trade-offs between Kubernetes Pod Security Standards levels (Privileged, Baseline, Restricted). Which level should be the default for a production environment running financial applications, and why? Provide evidence from real-world breaches such as the 2021 Codecov supply chain attack involving container escapes.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Pair students to teach-back one item from the Kubernetes Security Checklist (e.g., one explains RBAC configurations, the other network policies). Switch roles and quiz each other on common misconfigurations.
active_learning.problem_solving: Present a vulnerable Kubernetes deployment YAML (e.g., Pod running as root with hostPath volumes). In groups, fix it to meet Restricted PSS, then audit using tools like kube-bench and present fixes.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Container Orchestration Security (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Software Development Security > SDLC > 009_Deployment and Release > Cloud Deployment Security > Container Orchestration Security). **Research Context:** Containers are lightweight packages; orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes) manages them. Security focuses on lifecycle protection via PSS (Privileged/Baseline/Restricted policies preventing escalations), Kubernetes Security Checklist (RBAC, network policies, secrets), CNAPP (e.g., Prisma Cloud for build-to-runtime protection). Common threats: image vulns (use Trivy), RBAC misconfigs, runtime escapes. Tools: kube-bench, OPA Gatekeeper. Sources: 1) Kubernetes PSS: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/security/pod-security-standards/ (Enforces pod isolation); 2) CIS Kubernetes Benchmark: https://www.cisecurity.org/benchmark/kubernetes (Comprehensive checklist); 3) CNAPP Overview: https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/cyberpedia/what-is-a-cloud-native-application-protection-platform-cnapp (Integrates CWPP + CSPM); 4) Kube-bench: https://github.com/aquasecurity/kube-bench (CIS auditing tool). **Pedagogy Integration:** Use these learning objectives [insert array above]. Incorporate active learning hooks (e.g., reference debate on PSS trade-offs). Scaffold across 4 layers [insert array above]. **Task:** Generate 50 flashcards following the exact schema [insert schema above]. Output as JSON array of objects. Ensure flashcards promote active recall, error identification (distractors from voter-suggested threats), and progression through Bloom's. Vary formats but prioritize MCQs. Link to real-world (e.g., breaches). No duplicates; cover prerequisites like Docker basics.
